title: Attention, music lovers! Mark the dates for Folk Music Festival & Imagine Music Festival
text: Attention, music lovers! Mark the dates for Folk Music Festival & Imagine Music Festival By ET Bureau | 30 Jul, 2015, 05.17AM IST ET-Travel offers you events in Luxury, Entertainment, Food, Sports, Music and Nightlife to experience around the world. (representational image) (Getty Images) () ET-Travel offers you events in Luxury, Entertainment, Food, Sports, Music and Nightlife to experience around the world. Mount Hagen cultural show When : August 15, 2015 Where : Papua New Guinea - If you love tribal lore then here's a chance to celebrate the tribal spirit. Head to Mount Hagen, which has boomed in the past 40 years, and is now the third largest city in Papua New Guinea. The Mount Hagen Cultural Show has been made more tourist-friendly. A mix of tribal traditions and modern entertainment are designed to attract international and domestic travellers, and there is now a prize for the winning cultural group. This ensures that the 'singsings' are a colourful, competitive affair, with performers drumming, chanting and dancing at a pace that leaves even the audience breathless. When : From July till October annually Where : Kenya - Termed as the eighth wonder of the world and characterising the struggle for survival in the great African plains' harsh environment, around 1.4 million wildebeest migrate to the Maasai Mara in Kenya , round and back again in a never-ending quest for fresh pastures. You can witness this spectacle of the nature by participating in the safaris, which are organised specifically around the migration. Stay over at the numerous camps and lodges that offer a chance to observe in style or rough it in a tent. During the migration period, animal sightings are aplenty and catching a glimpse of lions tracking down their hunt or elephants grazing the greener pastures is a sight you will love to watch. Obon When : August 8-12, 2015 Where : Japan - Obon is an annual Buddhist event for commemorating one's ancestors. It is believed that each year during obon, the ancestors' spirits return to this world in order to visit their relatives. Traditionally, lanterns are hung in front of houses to guide the ancestors' spirits, obon dances (bon odori) are performed, graves are visited and food offerings are made at house altars and temples. At the end of Obon, floating lanterns are put into rivers, lakes and seas in order to guide the spirits back into their world. The customs followed vary strongly from region to region. The Obon week in mid August is one of Japan's three major holiday seasons. Imagine Music Festival When : August 29, 2015 Where : Atlanta, USA - Imagine Music Festival (IMF) is a two-day dance music and arts festival held annually in Atlanta, Georgia. Founded by IRIS Presents, the festival features multiple stages hosting the world's top musicians, bands and DJs. Conveniently located in the heart of Atlanta, Imagine Music Festival is easily accessible with plenty of parking, a short walk to all mass transit, and your choice of the city's best hotels. Home to the nation's busiest airport, Atlanta offers perfectly convenient and economical travel options for all festival-goers. There are three venues - Historic Fourth Ward Park, Masquerade Music Park and Clear Creek Basin - to create an unforgettable 360-degree experience. Folk Music Festival When : August 13-16, 2015 Where : Philadelphia - The Philadelphia Folk Festival transforms a working farm into a magical, musical sound park and the effect all around is magical. This event is the longest continuously running outdoors musical festival of its kind in North America and will celebrate its 54th anniversary from August 13-16, 2015 at the Old Pool Farm. Known to present superstars and rising stars alike, this year, organisers are especially proud to announce that 35 Philadelphia Music Co-op members have secured coveted slots. Acts will be performing on all 8 stages, making the Co-op an integral part of the event!
